intro: Melicope lohiauana, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in wet forest habitats. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, fragrant flowers that are usually yellow or greenish-yellow. Its fruits are fleshy drupes that contain one or two seeds. Melicope lohiauana plays an important ecological role in its native environment and is considered a keystone species in certain forest ecosystems.
